page.title: 01WEST BUCKFASTLEIGH PARISH
page.content:
A quiet and attractive rural area on the eastern border of{Dartmoor,} consisting for the most part of farmland, traversed by the parallel valleys of the Holy Brook and River Mardle. Being within the{National} {Park,}all the main tracks and paths are waymarked, and offer a variety of interesting walks.{The Abbot's Way, once an important medieval track between Buckfast and Tavistock Abbeys, and now a favourite route for Dartmoor walkers, crosses the area along a minor road before striking out over the moor from Cross Furzes.
The main centre of habitation is the village of Scorriton, with the two neighbouring hamlets of Michelcombe and Combe.
